001// Copyright (c) Choreo contributors
002
003package choreo.auto;
004
005import choreo.Choreo;
006import choreo.Choreo.TrajectoryCache;
007import choreo.Choreo.TrajectoryLogger;
008import choreo.trajectory.SwerveSample;
009import choreo.trajectory.Trajectory;
010import choreo.trajectory.TrajectorySample;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
012import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DriverStation;
013import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase;
014import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
015import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
016import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Commands;
017import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem;
018import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button.Trigger;
019import java.util.HashMap;
020import java.util.List;
021import java.util.Optional;
022import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
023import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
024import java.util.function.Supplier;
025
026/**
027 * A factory used to create autonomous routines.
028 *
029 * <p>Here is an example of how to use this class to create an auto routine:
030 *
031 * <h2>Example using <code>Trigger</code>s</h2>
032 *
033 * <pre><code>
034 * public Command shootThenMove(AutoFactory factory) {
035 *   // Create a new auto loop to return
036 *   var loop = factory.newLoop();
037 *
038 *   // Create a trajectory that moves the robot 2 meters
039 *   AutoTrajectory trajectory = factory.trajectory("move2meters", loop);
040 *
041 *   // Will automatically run the shoot command when the auto loop is first polled
042 *   loop.enabled().onTrue(shooter.shoot());
043 *
044 *   // Gets a trigger from the shooter to if the shooter has a note, and will run the trajectory
045 *   // command when the shooter does not have a note
046 *   loop.enabled().and(shooter.hasNote()).onFalse(trajectory.cmd());
047 *
048 *   return loopcmd().withName("ShootThenMove");
049 * }
050 * </code></pre>
051 *
052 * <h2>Example using <code>CommandGroup</code>s</h2>
053 *
054 * <pre><code>
055 * public Command shootThenMove(AutoFactory factory) {
056 *   // Create a trajectory that moves the robot 2 meters
057 *   Command trajectory = factory.trajectoryCommand("move2meters");
058 *
059 *   return shooter.shoot()
060 *      .andThen(trajectory)
061 *      .withName("ShootThenMove");
062 * }
063 * </code></pre>
064 */
065public class AutoFactory {
066  private static final AutoLoop VOID_LOOP =
067      new AutoLoop("VOID-LOOP") {
068        private final EventLoop loop = new EventLoop();
069
070        @Override
071        public Command cmd() {
072          return Commands.none().withName("VoidLoop:" + name);
073        }
074
075        @Override
076        public Command cmd(BooleanSupplier finishCondition) {
077          return Commands.none().withName("VoidLoop:" + name);
078        }
079
080        @Override
081        public void poll() {}
082
083        @Override
084        public void reset() {}
085
086        @Override
087        public Trigger enabled() {
088          return new Trigger(loop, () -> false);
089        }
090      };
091
092  /** A class used to bind commands to events in all trajectories created by this factory. */
093  public static class AutoBindings {
094    private HashMap<String, Command> bindings = new HashMap<>();
095
096    /** Default constructor. */
097    public AutoBindings() {}
098
099    /**
100     * Binds a command to an event in all trajectories created by the factory using this bindings.
101     *
102     * @param name The name of the event to bind the command to.
103     * @param cmd The command to bind to the event.
104     * @return The bindings object for chaining.
105     */
106    public AutoBindings bind(String name, Command cmd) {
107      bindings.put(name, cmd);
108      return this;
109    }
110
111    private void merge(AutoBindings other) {
112      bindings.putAll(other.bindings);
113    }
114
115    /**
116     * Gets the bindings map.
117     *
118     * @return The bindings map.
119     */
120    HashMap<String, Command> getBindings() {
121      return bindings;
122    }
123  }
124
125  private final TrajectoryCache trajectoryCache = new TrajectoryCache();
126  private final Supplier<Pose2d> poseSupplier;
127  private final BiConsumer<Pose2d, ? extends TrajectorySample<?>> controller;
128  private final BooleanSupplier mirrorTrajectory;
129  private final Subsystem driveSubsystem;
130  private final AutoBindings bindings = new AutoBindings();
131  private final Optional<TrajectoryLogger<? extends TrajectorySample<?>>> trajectoryLogger;
132
133  /**
134   * Its recommended to use the {@link Choreo#createAutoFactory} to create a new instance of this
135   * class.
136   *
137   * @param <SampleType> {@link Choreo#createAutoFactory}
138   * @param poseSupplier {@link Choreo#createAutoFactory}
139   * @param controller {@link Choreo#createAutoFactory}
140   * @param mirrorTrajectory {@link Choreo#createAutoFactory}
141   * @param driveSubsystem {@link Choreo#createAutoFactory}
142   * @param bindings {@link Choreo#createAutoFactory}
143   * @param trajectoryLogger {@link Choreo#createAutoFactory}
144   */
145  public <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>> AutoFactory(
146      Supplier<Pose2d> poseSupplier,
147      BiConsumer<Pose2d, SampleType> controller,
148      BooleanSupplier mirrorTrajectory,
149      Subsystem driveSubsystem,
150      AutoBindings bindings,
151      Optional<TrajectoryLogger<SampleType>> trajectoryLogger) {
152    this.poseSupplier = poseSupplier;
153    this.controller = controller;
154    this.mirrorTrajectory = mirrorTrajectory;
155    this.driveSubsystem = driveSubsystem;
156    this.bindings.merge(bindings);
157    this.trajectoryLogger =
158        trajectoryLogger.map(logger -> (TrajectoryLogger<? extends TrajectorySample<?>>) logger);
159  }
160
161  /**
162   * Creates a new auto loop to be used to make an auto routine.
163   *
164   * @param name The name of the auto loop.
165   * @return A new auto loop.
166   * @see AutoLoop
167   * @see #voidLoop
168   */
169  public AutoLoop newLoop(String name) {
170    // Clear cache in simulation to allow a form of "hot-reloading" trajectories
171    if (RobotBase.isSimulation()) {
172      clearCache();
173    }
174
175    return new AutoLoop(name);
176  }
177
178  /**
179   * An Auto Loop that cannot have any side-effects, it stores no state and does nothing when
180   * polled.
181   *
182   * @return A void auto loop.
183   * @see AutoLoop
184   * @see #newLoop
185   */
186  public AutoLoop voidLoop() {
187    return VOID_LOOP;
188  }
189
190  /**
191   * Creates a new auto trajectory to be used in an auto routine.
192   *
193   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
194   * @param loop The auto loop to use as the triggers polling context.
195   * @return A new auto trajectory.
196   */
197  public AutoTrajectory trajectory(String trajectoryName, AutoLoop loop) {
198    Optional<? extends Trajectory<?>> optTrajectory =
199        trajectoryCache.loadTrajectory(trajectoryName);
200    Trajectory<?> trajectory;
201    if (optTrajectory.isPresent()) {
202      trajectory = optTrajectory.get();
203    } else {
204      DriverStation.reportError("Could not load trajectory: " + trajectoryName, false);
205      trajectory = new Trajectory<SwerveSample>(trajectoryName, List.of(), List.of(), List.of());
206    }
207    return trajectory(trajectory, loop);
208  }
209
210  /**
211   * Creates a new auto trajectory to be used in an auto routine.
212   *
213   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
214   * @param splitIndex The index of the split trajectory to use.
215   * @param loop The auto loop to use as the triggers polling context.
216   * @return A new auto trajectory.
217   */
218  public AutoTrajectory trajectory(String trajectoryName, final int splitIndex, AutoLoop loop) {
219    Optional<? extends Trajectory<?>> optTrajectory =
220        trajectoryCache.loadTrajectory(trajectoryName, splitIndex);
221    Trajectory<?> trajectory;
222    if (optTrajectory.isPresent()) {
223      trajectory = optTrajectory.get();
224    } else {
225      DriverStation.reportError("Could not load trajectory: " + trajectoryName, false);
226      trajectory = new Trajectory<SwerveSample>(trajectoryName, List.of(), List.of(), List.of());
227    }
228    return trajectory(trajectory, loop);
229  }
230
231  /**
232   * Creates a new auto trajectory to be used in an auto routine.
233   *
234   * @param <SampleType> The type of the trajectory samples.
235   * @param trajectory The trajectory to use.
236   * @param loop The auto loop to use as the triggers polling context.
237   * @return A new auto trajectory.
238   */
239  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
240  public <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>> AutoTrajectory trajectory(
241      Trajectory<SampleType> trajectory, AutoLoop loop) {
242    // type solidify everything
243    final Trajectory<SampleType> solidTrajectory = trajectory;
244    final BiConsumer<Pose2d, SampleType> solidController =
245        (BiConsumer<Pose2d, SampleType>) this.controller;
246    final Optional<TrajectoryLogger<SampleType>> solidLogger =
247        this.trajectoryLogger.map(logger -> (TrajectoryLogger<SampleType>) logger);
248    return new AutoTrajectory(
249        trajectory.name(),
250        solidTrajectory,
251        poseSupplier,
252        solidController,
253        mirrorTrajectory,
254        solidLogger,
255        driveSubsystem,
256        loop.getLoop(),
257        bindings);
258  }
259
260  /**
261   * Creates a new auto trajectory command to be used in an auto routine.
262   *
263   * <p><b>Important </b>
264   *
265   * <p>{@link #trajectoryCommand} and {@link #trajectory} methods should not be mixed in the same
266   * auto routine. {@link #trajectoryCommand} is used as an escape hatch for teams that don't need
267   * the benefits of the {@link #trajectory} method and its {@link Trigger} API. {@link
268   * #trajectoryCommand} does not invoke bindings added via calling {@link #bind} or {@link
269   * AutoBindings} passed into the factory constructor.
270   *
271   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
272   * @return A new auto trajectory.
273   */
274  public Command trajectoryCommand(String trajectoryName) {
275    return trajectory(trajectoryName, VOID_LOOP).cmd();
276  }
277
278  /**
279   * Creates a new auto trajectory command to be used in an auto routine.
280   *
281   * <p><b>Important </b>
282   *
283   * <p>{@link #trajectoryCommand} and {@link #trajectory} methods should not be mixed in the same
284   * auto routine. {@link #trajectoryCommand} is used as an escape hatch for teams that don't need
285   * the benefits of the {@link #trajectory} method and its {@link Trigger} API. {@link
286   * #trajectoryCommand} does not invoke bindings added via calling {@link #bind} or {@link
287   * AutoBindings} passed into the factory constructor.
288   *
289   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
290   * @param splitIndex The index of the split trajectory to use.
291   * @return A new auto trajectory.
292   */
293  public Command trajectoryCommand(String trajectoryName, final int splitIndex) {
294    return trajectory(trajectoryName, splitIndex, VOID_LOOP).cmd();
295  }
296
297  /**
298   * Creates a new auto trajectory command to be used in an auto routine.
299   *
300   * <p><b>Important </b>
301   *
302   * <p>{@link #trajectoryCommand} and {@link #trajectory} methods should not be mixed in the same
303   * auto routine. {@link #trajectoryCommand} is used as an escape hatch for teams that don't need
304   * the benefits of the {@link #trajectory} method and its {@link Trigger} API. {@link
305   * #trajectoryCommand} does not invoke bindings added via calling {@link #bind} or {@link
306   * AutoBindings} passed into the factory constructor.
307   *
308   * @param <SampleType> The type of the trajectory samples.
309   * @param trajectory The trajectory to use.
310   * @return A new auto trajectory.
311   */
312  public <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>> Command trajectoryCommand(
313      Trajectory<SampleType> trajectory) {
314    return trajectory(trajectory, VOID_LOOP).cmd();
315  }
316
317  /**
318   * Binds a command to an event in all trajectories created after this point.
319   *
320   * @param name The name of the trajectory to bind the command to.
321   * @param cmd The command to bind to the trajectory.
322   */
323  public void bind(String name, Command cmd) {
324    bindings.bind(name, cmd);
325  }
326
327  /**
328   * The {@link AutoFactory} caches trajectories with a {@link TrajectoryCache} to avoid reloading
329   * the same trajectory multiple times. This can have the side effect of keeping a single copy of
330   * every trajectory ever loaded in memory aslong as the factory is loaded. This method clears the
331   * cache of all trajectories.
332   *
333   * <p><b>Usage Note:</b>
334   *
335   * <p>Never clearing the cache is unlikely to have an impact on the robots performance on a rio 2
336   */
337  public void clearCache() {
338    trajectoryCache.clear();
339  }
340}
